definition: predecessor/ex-/former/ex (spouse etc)
front/forward/ahead/first/top (followed by a number)/future/ago/before/BC (e.g. 前293年)/former/formerly
surname Ren/Ren County 任縣|任县[Ren2 Xian4] in Hebei

to assign/to appoint/to take up a post/office/responsibility/to let/to allow/to give free rein to/no matter (how, what etc)/classifier for terms served in office, or for spouses, girlfriends etc (as in 前任男友)

sentences.english: The former chief has got typhus fever on board.
sentences.chinese: 前任大副在船得過斑疹傷寒症。

sentences.english: Wan replaces the outgoing science minister, Xu Guanhua, who is retiring.
sentences.chinese: 萬鋼的前任徐冠華部長已經到了退休年齡。

sentences.english: Sleeping with an ex is the sexual slip-up people most commonly expect to get away with.
sentences.chinese: 與前任偷情是最多數人想抹掉的性錯誤。

sentences.english: Honey, if ex-boyfriends were dollars…you'd be loaded by now.
sentences.chinese: 如果前任男友能當錢，如今就是富婆了。

sentences.english: Her predecessor, Ricardo Lagos, was known on occasion to take the subway to work.
sentences.chinese: 而她的前任拉戈斯據說有時甚至會乘坐地鐵上班。

sentences.english: He seemed to relish the pressure and focus that had eclipsed his predecessors.
sentences.chinese: 安帥對壓力和聚焦的把握能力讓他的前任黯然失色。

sentences.english: His predecessor Bill Clinton did not escape "criticism from Confucius" either.
sentences.chinese: 他的前任克林頓也沒能逃脫來自孔子的“諄諄教誨”。

sentences.english: As soon as the slave got back into town, he was captured by his former master.
sentences.chinese: 奴隸一回到鎮中，馬上就被他的前任主人逮個正着。

sentences.english: The willingness of the ex-leader and the successor will also influence the results of the succession.
sentences.chinese: 前任和繼任主體的交接意願影響到繼任的效果。

sentences.english: You remind me of my ex-girlfriend.
sentences.chinese: 你使我念起我的前任女友。

sentences.english: An ex is flirting, do not entertain them please.
sentences.chinese: 你的前任開始賣弄風情，千萬別取悅他們。

sentences.english: Tom is also the creator and former project lead for the jBPM project.
sentences.chinese: Tom還是jBPM項目的創建者和前任項目領導。

sentences.english: Mr Obama has managed to develop a political career far more lucrative than those of his predecessors.
sentences.chinese: 奧巴馬政治生涯的“錢途”遠超過他的前任們。

sentences.english: So, Penny says that her husband – her ex-husband – is paying child support.
sentences.chinese: 因此，Penny說他的前任丈夫在支付孩子撫養費。

sentences.english: China refused to deal with Ma's pro-independence predecessor.
sentences.chinese: 大陸拒絕與馬英九親獨立的前任打交道。

sentences.english: We took about 800 ornaments left over from previous administration.
sentences.chinese: 前任政府留下了800多件裝飾品。

definition: to occupy a post currently/current (president etc)/incumbent/(coll.) current boyfriend (girlfriend, spouse)
newly-appointed/newly elected/new (in a political office)
new flame/new lover
to part company/to split up/to break up
to leave office/to leave one's post
old affection
change of affection, shift of love (idiom); to change one's feelings to another love/to fall in love with sb else
lit. lotus roots may break, but the fiber remains joined (idiom); lovers part, but still long for one another
to remain in office/to hold on to one's job
lit. that person/fig. the person you have been looking for/Mr Right/the girl of one's dreams
ex-wife/late wife
to turn over old accounts/fig. to revive old quarrels/to reopen old wounds
to betray
shady relationship/affair/adulterous relationship
to leave office
to do the splits (gymnastics)/(Tw) two-timing (in romantic relationships)/Taiwan pr. [pi1 tui3]
